intro: Mollinedia puberula, commonly known as the silky mollinedia, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine pubescence. Mollinedia puberula produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family.
